website_summaries.verdict: The D-Link EXO AC3000 is a tri-band router that delivered speedy throughput in our tests and offers solid parental controls, malware protection, and mesh technology.
pros: Strong parental controls and built-in malware protection

customer_reviews.title: Great wifi Router with great features but cant replace my ISP router completely as no inbuilt modem.
customer_reviews.text: Great wifi Router with great features but cant replace my ISP router completely as no inbuilt modem. Very very smooth set up with the app. Mcafee based protection for all devices. And lot more but Just can not do without modem. So the cable has to come from the ISP modem/router to this Dlink router for the internet. But I am still happy I just moved all the wired and wifi connections to this Dlink router.
customer_reviews.author: Manjinder Singh

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: This is my 1st proper router and I'm very pleased, the routers ISPs provide are just cheap rubbish. I got a big speed boost straight away compared to the Vodafone router on the wired connection and the WIFI is also a lot better. There's a lot more features and everything just works easier and better.
customer_reviews.author: L. Pope

customer_reviews.title: Good router for reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Good router, has plenty of settings for a normal (or even advanced) user. I do not use McAfee, think it is pure marketing with no added value, because my current OS and provider keep me more than safe. The only challenge was proper antenna positioning, had to surf the internet quite a bit. Ended up with rear antennas headed straight vertical, front ones slightly inclined with 105 degrees between them, as on official pictures. Always check wifi signal strength, because every home is different: I used android apps - IOS does not allow you to see wifi tech details for some reason.
customer_reviews.author: Nills

customer_reviews.title: Did not live up to expectations, wish I returned it before it was too late.
customer_reviews.text: Before I get into my other issues with this router, the WiFi signal is poor, so if that’s all you care about I would avoid it. I had better WiFi signal from my virgin hub. Aside from that, the management interface is ridiculously lacking for such an expensive router. Even in advanced mode you can’t do much more than change some basic settings through “wizards”. I’ve had the router for a few months and I’m finally sick of it, so replacing it with an edgerouter and unifi AP. Wish I just went that way in the first place, rather than overpaying for a low grade generic home router in a fancy plastic shell.
customer_reviews.author: Callum

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Very good product. Did have some teathing problems during set up and the D-Link defend software is a little problematic. But the important thing is it has improved my wifi signal though out the house massively. D-Link defend problems. The software is slow in accepting new devices onto the network. It would appear I have to accept it as a trusted device before it allows the device access to the network. Confusing I know. Basically I have to put network code into new device, try to connect, wait for the rejection, open up the software accept new device, reconnect the device and then it works ok.
customer_reviews.author: Paddy C

customer_reviews.title: Decent wireless router
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a replacement wireless router for my virginmedia hub 3, found this and thought I’d give it a go.. so far it’s working a charm, no matter where I am in the house I get my full 200mbs via WiFi, the virgin hub only gave me 20mb in the furthest location. For gaming it’s also great my ms is around 10ms where the virgin hub on witless sat around 40/50ms
customer_reviews.author: M Shreeves

customer_reviews.title: Good if using it out of the box with the default settings
customer_reviews.text: This is a basic Wi-Fi router. It has a neat interface, but it's too limited. Static routes were only configurable over the Wan interface. This was a huge disappointment. I ended up keeping it as a separate Wi-Fi for all the household devices and general internet access. My home network I run off a Zyxel vmg8924 which although older is much more configurable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with 2.4Hhz Security cameras other than that a pretty decent router for the money
customer_reviews.text: After spending hours going through multiple forums , it turns out this router will not work with Yi 2.4ghz cameras desie the fact its dual band. Problem is when trying to switch it to all 2.4ghz on initial setup up to connect the cameras first before moving it to smart connect. 2.4ghz network does not show up on phone or laptops. Apart from that its a pretty good router. Have returned it and ordered an alternative router
customer_reviews.author: Tudanski

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic router.Excellent service from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I bought this at a knock down price in the black friday deals, even at full price it's worth every single penny. It's the best router I've ever used. It's easy to set up. It's super fast on both the WiFi bands. Once again super fast delivery service from amazon uk.
customer_reviews.author: JsyMaxius67

customer_reviews.title: Stay clear! The inbuilt McAfees does not work as expected
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this device, the built in McAfees does not work as expected, at first I was very impressed with the reach of the wifi and functionality. However I soon started to see weirdness round websites not returning any content, after a lengthy process dealing with support and my own investigations it appears the router was corrupting DNS packets. This would be random. As soon as McAfees was turned off the issue would go away, I was eventually given a new firmware upgrade to test but I was still seeing issues. I am now in the process of sending the device back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. D. Whyte

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, but the compatible WIFI extenders have been discontinued
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product about 6 months ago. Works well, good speeds, easy to set up and manage. The problem came when I moved to a larger property and decided to take advantage of the Mesh Network capabilities it advertises. Here and on the website the compatible range extender for this product is the DAP-1620. That product has now been discontinued in the UK, despite still being advertised as a key component of this Routers Mesh capabilities. Very poor, and false advertising
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as it looks
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a Virgin Superhub 3. The range on the 5ghz is far better but the speed is maybe 60%. The 2ghz is much faster... But the range is very very limited in comparison to the Superhub. A pointless purchase. Returned! Max speed on internal networking over 5g/AC was 360mbps. The Virgin hub hits around 500 Mbps. The 2ghz range is at least double the on the virgin hub but half the speed. Update - Turned out I had a faulty unit. Awesome router. Good range and speed.
customer_reviews.author: RCL

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great wifi coverage.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this router for my office. We had really struggled with wifi coverage for a long time trying various routers with no luck, finally we've got coverage! Easy to set up, fast download /upload speeds. It has made such a difference to our productivity at work. We download up to 50gb of video per day so we're now able to do this quickly with no drop outs - highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: A J Morrow

customer_reviews.title: get it to work
customer_reviews.text: I could not get it to work I sent D-Link two Emails but had no reply its useless. I have add the Email I sent to them below. I thing of tell Computer Active as they give it a good write-up Iv just purchased your D-Link AC1900 smart mesh , when I plug in the lead to the Internet socket It cuts off my phone and shows a message on the phone ( Check Phone Line ) when I unplug it The phone is ok and its ok then I plug my old router back in can you tell me what I am doing wrong please
customer_reviews.author: Peter Watts

customer_reviews.title: disappointing
customer_reviews.text: tried to use it with virgin media. poor WiFi signal in a 1 bed flat. Sent it back, no worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Fabio

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the standard Virgin WiFi Signal!
customer_reviews.text: I bout this because i wanted to get a better wifi signal in my room as I have a 200mb connection with Virgin, and just moved into a new house, but was only getting 40 on my pc. I bought this and at first it was significantly better, but now that i've put my pc where i want to put it, the regular virgin wifi is still kicking out about 40, but now this can't even connect! those external antennas don't really seem to be worth very much after all, highly dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: ALamle

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely dreadful, stay clear (March 2020)
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely dreadful, I connected this to Sky Q hub and it worked for about 6 hours, after that it was constant WiFi disconnects, sometimes it would get stuck and was unable to reconnect prompting the D-Link app to request a restart, this process takes about 3 minutes. I thought my Sky Hub was bad, this is even worse. Stay clear. Refund/Return processed.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan R. G. Manning

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Router
customer_reviews.text: This router is utterly brilliant, if your like me and have many electronic devices all vying for the internet, then this is the solution the tri band is fantastic, use it to separate your old devices from the faster ones, it’s brilliant.
customer_reviews.author: Atif Iqbal

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else
customer_reviews.text: Initially good impressions but these soon changed when random devices constantly lost wireless connectivity, and the only way to restore was to reset the router. This got worse over time and became intolerable . Amazon support were very helpful and sent a replacement within 2 days but this soon displayed the same problems. So I have opted for a refund and will try another make.
customer_reviews.author: mark gibson

customer_reviews.title: Costly after McAfee trial and Google Assistant no longer integrated
customer_reviews.text: Bought because of interaction with Google Assistant but "Talk to D-Link Wi-Fi" is no longer available on Google Assistant/Home. Also would have to pay a Mcafee fee after free trial period to use the Defend app.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin N Ginders

customer_reviews.title: Great hardware... range sucks...
customer_reviews.text: Even tho I've owned used the router for one day, my use case was very specific and that was for improved range. My Smarthub 2 can't cover the whole house and reviews of this indicated it had excellent range. Disappointingly, it still beat the D-Link X1860. This is a real shame. The hardware and speed is great and being an AX router, would have future proofed my network.
customer_reviews.author: Mike P.

customer_reviews.title: Placed on the middle floor of my house and now have WiFi everywhere.
customer_reviews.text: Powerline adaptor from my Virgin router to this, turned off the WiFi on my Virgin router which struggled to even get to the 2nd floor and now this covers all three floors.
customer_reviews.author: SkilledNutter

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing WiFi
customer_reviews.text: The router connected simply, straight to my Virgin hub, however WiFi drop outs were worse with this than with my original hub. It then didn't want to reconnect without rebooting. I changed some WiFi settings and rebooted and got back on but 10 mins later the same. Afraid I am sending back now. Promises so much for the price but doesn't hold up to the promise.
customer_reviews.author: Chico A N Eden

customer_reviews.title: Price is about right
customer_reviews.text: i’ve found this router to be very good,easy to setup and configure i’ve got wi-fi everywhere with no problems,not had to use tech support yet.
customer_reviews.author: Fredrico

customer_reviews.title: Works with Virgin hub
customer_reviews.text: So far I am very happy with it. It connected to my virgin hub 3 and now has a better signal across the house
customer_reviews.author: ALO

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work for me, connected it up for a couple of days. didn't make a difference to my crappy VM router wifi distance.
customer_reviews.author: Ozzy

customer_reviews.title: Great router for peace of mind wifi
customer_reviews.text: I've got loads of smart home devices; thermostat, security systems, Sonos etc but none of these devices were protected. The Dlink router was really easy to set up and comes with McAffee to protect your network. Great product at a competitive price :)
customer_reviews.author: Nick P

customer_reviews.title: No EXO Extenders in UK
customer_reviews.text: D-Link Technical Support Emailed back stating 'Unfortunately the DRA-2060 EXO Extender is not available in Europe,. However, if you are looking to extend your Wi-Fi I would recommend our DA-1665. This alternative is huge, therefore D-Link EXO Router is NOT-FIT FOR PURPOSE.
customer_reviews.author: "alecplumb"

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I have a weak Wi-Fi network and because this needs power from your network router itself only makes it worse then it was before! Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Great controls and app
customer_reviews.text: Makes everything so much easier and the app is pretty good. The dual core helps and is noticed when using multiple devices
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great router!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, boosted our WiFi significantly & has a hook on the back to hang on the wall
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Watson

customer_reviews.title: Tell customer that a modem is needed
customer_reviews.text: Not obvious. I discovered that I needed an external modem! If I'm right what is the one which fit with the router? #Thank you
customer_reviews.author: tgnt

product_meta.title: D-Link DIR-3060, EXO AC3000 Smart Wi-Fi Gaming Router, Tri-Band, 802.11 AC Wave 2 with MU-MIMO, Gigabit WAN, 4 x Gigabit LAN, Alexa Compatible, Built-In Mcafee Protection
product_meta.description: Pattern Name:Gaming AC3000| Size Name:WiFi 5 with MU-MIMO & McAfee protectionIt incorporates the recent wireless tri-band technology: MU-MIMO wave 2 for up to 4 x faster performance and smart mesh for seamless Wi-Fi network throughout the home. Combined Wi-Fi speed of up to 3000 Mbps WLAN, in tri-band solution (3 x 3, 2 5 GHz and 1 2.4 GHz bands), for 4K streaming without cutting, pulling or pixelated videos. 6 high power MIMO Wi-Fi antennas with enhanced smart beam to maximize the coverage area and speed of your wireless network. Lan and Internet network ports to Gigabit Ethernet RJ45, so your data flows across your network at full speed and you can make more of your fibre connection. 1 SuperSpeed USB 3.0 port and a USB 2.0 port for connecting USB drives and data sharing. Compatible with Alexa and Google Home voice assistants.
feature_bullets: Featuring the recent Wi-Fi technology with MU-MIMO to deliver a reliable wireless connection with combined speeds of up to 3,000 Mbps over 3 dedicated wireless bands using 6 high power antennas
Includes 5-year McAfee secure home Platform subscription, protecting all devices connected to your network and keeping your kids safe online with comprehensive parental Control
With four Gigabit LAN ports, connect up to 4 wired devices for speeds up to 10 x faster than standard Fast Ethernet connections
SPEEDTEST powered, allowing you to find out the true speed of your internet, straight from the router
Includes 2-year McAfee LiveSafe subscription which allows you to install antivirus software onto unlimited number of computers, tablets and smartphones for 2 years
